I hope they got new management because it was so fun working there and petting animals, and talking to people about their pets everyday. The people that worked there were down to earth and friendly. Also that was just the Chico location so who knows. Working at a pet store is a great experience especially as a first job.

The only reason I stayed at the petsmart pets hotel was because I loved the animals. My coworkers were awful, management sucked, we never had the supplies we needed, something was always broken. On multiple occasions I left work in tears because of the way I was treated by coworkers and one of my managers- they were all bullies. One of my managers even had a group chat with some of my coworkers in which they just gossiped and talked about other coworkers. She has multiple complaints against her and nothing ever happened. The job itself was great, but the environment and treatment I had to deal with were awful.
It was a fun job if you love animals. Management wasn’t good. All drama was brought out. Some managers were rude and so many quit. Store isn’t organized and pay isn’t good
The job itself was decent. It wasn’t to hard, but the lack of pay( especially during this Covid-19 ) sucked.  Seniority doesn’t really get you anywhere and the customers can be rude at times

Working here was both challenging and rewarding. The managers were very passionate, productive, positive and patient. This company has a system that leaves all of its associates on the same page as far as procedures and tasks go, and they really advocated for team effort and unity. Comstmer service was always excellent and you also got to work with animals!
I am dedicated to finishing my tasks properly and on time, and i work hard to finish my work and do it thoroughly. I care about my quality of work and how it reflects my work ethic.

Best job ever. They teach you in a very good way how to handle dogs with care, and how to properly bathe them, how to properly do their nails as well as drying them out and taking care of any other thing they need. 10/10.

pay is sub-par.  during the coronavirus pandemic, almost all other retailers gave pay increases to those who continued to work petsmart did not even give employees a stick of gum in fact the laid off almost all employees but continued to pay peanuts to those to stayed and in fact increased our workloads to make up for those laid off.  Petsmart cares about the bottom line ONLY it is bad enough they are so overpriced but to have employees risk health and not even get a thank you
All they want is money and don't care about the employees. They never give you a compliment for a good job and all the management plays favorites and fried me after 11 years.
Pros: You can bring your dog to work with you
If you love dogs and can spare a few days of your week, I highly recommend working here for a while

Everything that happens is your fault and the customer is always right. Management is never on your side, and you are made a fool of in front of customers just to make them happy. The Store Manager knows nothing about animals and regularly says things to grooming clients that are untrue. Management will almost always give out free grooms/discounted grooms for any tiny problem a customer might have instead of backing up the groomer.
Management style was positive and consistent for employees. Guidance for new employees. Team work, fair pricing and associates were trained and trained again. I highly recommend this company.
I ended up leaving because I had no car and no transpiration I have a car now and insurance I can drive to any job u offer me .

They work you like a dog then fire you for any justifiable reason. Not to mention they promise a bonus for performance but keep in mind they will take hundreds from you for the small technically. Petsmart doesnt not care about you anymore then Walmart.
It was ok. I started there with a bright and happy outlook on the general public and it slowly went down hill. The customers are crazy and you grow accustomed to it eventually lol.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

It is fast pace but  you get to say hi to most of the animals coming in and out. The staff is great to work with. All the personalities are great. Managers are nice there. When you work there you are there to help pet parents and their partner (Pets) find what they need. The difficult part was selling Puppy Guides but other than that It is a fun place to work.

The coworkers are fantastic, the work itself is not bad, but the company does not give any thought to the day-to-day operations of the place. This place rarely prioritizes the animals and when they do so, it is at their convenience.
Unfortunately, it is clear right off the bat that sales will always come before animal care here. Management was typically friendly and work environment was pleasant, though.

In the salon production / speed/ income per ticket is more important than the groomers physical well being. You can break your body quickly and that's irrelevant to the higher ups, I've heard many salon/ store/even regional managers be asked about changes but it's on deaf ears.

Petsmart petshotel is a great place to work. The pet parents are great, the animals, and the staff too. I loved working there. I got really attached to all the animals who boarded and came in for day camp

Worked there 2 years out of necessity.  Would never go back. Working there is like going back to some immature high school gossipy place. It's so annoying.  On top of not getting paid faily, which is the #1 reason I'd never consider working there again.

Like many jobs I’ve worked at, this was a really great place to work but I had a manager there that stressed me out and at times could be unreasonable. I talked to coworkers and they said people usually quit because of her and I soon understood why

This by-far has been the best job I've ever had. It's so much fun seeing all the cute animals and getting to help customers who love animals just as much as myself. The management at my location was the best management I've ever had. They were not just my co-workers they were my family and we all looked out for one another. It was a true healthy, energetic, and caring environment. I truly loved this job more than anything.

I came to PetSmart after working as a waitress for 3 years and working other retail stores that work u to death. PetSmart offers way more to their employees as a company vacation, 401k and other healthy benefits. It's also a place u can actually advance in if you put in the hard work. And hard work it will be. I've gotten injured and my back's definitely suffering but it's a rewarding place to be. You will deal with a lot of ignorant customers who know nothing about their pets, but u take the good with the bad.

I enjoyed the job very much and loved learning more about animals daily. However my low ratings are mostly based on me being hired as a pet specialist, and ending up spending more time behind a vash register. I had made clear that i could not do that as i have back issues yet they would force and only schedule me to work register 90% of the time. Not employee friendly.

Workplace is great, if you enjoy a good workout. You work independently majority of the day. The order fill workers are all good company and easy to work with, most don't bat an eye when they need to lend a hand. However, the management is questionable. It is hard to enjoy working with people who pretend to take you seriously, act like they care or simply don't listen to you. It almost seems like if you're not making your production consistently by month 2 you're as good as useless but its also no different for the people that do make their production. The motivation and moral boost management provides is as good as nothing. It's also best to keep any concerns or issues to yourself seeing as they will either target you or completely dismiss you. I do believe that for every person hired, there should be a brief examination of the persons' capabilities and place them where they can actually be successful regardless of who was wherever first. Iv'e personally never seen a company like this who tells you everyday they want you to be successful but then when you express how you feel about the work your doing, especially if you know you can preform exceptionally somewhere else, they just simply dismiss it and tell you you're not doing your job right or that you're not working hard enough. The only benefits that I can acknowledge are the discounts and being in great shape, so long as you don't sprain anything or bruise any bones.

I'll start by saying that I've worked with some fantastic people at PetSmart, and that my coworkers make my experience there better than it would otherwise be. This includes but isn't limited to management at the store level. The problem at PetSmart is the company itself & the customers. The company does not care about it's employees. They don't care about employee safety or morale. It is a completely profits over people mindset. Employees are not heard at all when it comes to designing more safe & effective procedure & protocol.  They push employees beyond capacity and it benefits neither employees or customers in the end..

While at work (in grooming) you are constantly told to either do better or groom more animals, all while the managers actually have no clue how to groom or what a typical day of grooming consists of. Pet smart is a money hungry corporation that cares nothing for their employees and will fire anyone without hesitation. If you are passionate about animals and have a commitment to them then you should find anywhere but this corporation to work
PetSmart is a great place to work! The culture here is like no other and the possibilities of advancing are endless. The management team are always willing to help.
I worked at the Outer Loop location. I loved working with dogs and making friends with the regulars. My coworkers and salon manager were all funny and relaxed.

Petsmart had the greatest work enviroment the staf and management were helpful and friendly. They did daily reviews and check ups you always had someone checking to see if you were ok or needed help just overall great place.

I had an overall great experience while working with Petsmart. My employees were helpful and fun to be around. I started as a cashier and worked my way up through the company as a bather and ending as the pet trainer. A typical day in my work life as the pet trainer was keeping in touch with my pet parents are making sure my curriculum was up to date and I was ready to teach a class four days out of the week. The most enjoyable part of my job was spending time with my furry friends and helping the pet parents train their dogs.

I had some good days at Petsmart but a lot of bad days. The head manager is very against LGBT+ people and many who were LGBT+ quit due to him. Praise isn't given very often and many gave up trying to do their best work. I loved some of my coworkers! The coworkers are very friendly and willing to help. The head manager will avoid helping staff with upset customers and will not follow company rules. Managers also tend to ignore/blow off any lower staffs opinions. Managers/leads in the grooming and hotel were awesome though!!! Hopefully things will get better there, but you have to be willing to just stick to company rules and policies even when told to bend the rules a bit by management. Specific managers to keep an eye on is the Store leader and secondary leader/scheduler.

Management is terrible. People that don't deserve to be promoted frequently get promoted. Associates are often poorly trained and receive no support. People that clearly deserve to be fired somehow manage to avoid any consequences despite multiple write ups/complaints. The company bends over backwards to kiss up to customers, even when they're wrong or it goes against policy. I liked my coworkers, but I can't recommend this company.

As a "Pet Care Associate" for 3 and a half years. I can say that I love the actual work. Making sure everything is in optimal condition for the animals in our care is worth the low pay. However, when you realize that on a corporate level the animals' well-being is at the very bottom of the priority list, it gets pretty discouraging.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

I enjoyed my work a typical day would be some of the employees happy  to see you. No one passed on word of what needed to be done as far as changes. Then there were other managers that were Moody  and what about your head off . The hardest part of my job would be  having customers not respect your space  and being rude to you . I love my customers most of them were very nice and courteous and kind .  Price be there but you hardly ever saw the main manager.
I loved working here because of the animals. And they are very important part of the job as well as the pet parents. We make sure the animals feel safe.

one of the major issues i had was that petsmart cuts hours drastically throughout the year. The most you'll really work is sometimes in the summer, and the holidays. The only full time positions (at least at my most recent store) were only for managers. So if you're looking for a seasonal job this would be great. Even as a part time stocker i was only getting up to 10 hrs a week at one point.
my favorite part of the job is seeing puppies and dogs come in and my regular customers asking for me by name..what could be better about the job is more hours and pay
The management at Petsmart is amazing. They very hard to try and accommodate you and your life into their schedule. They like to try their best to work with you.

If you love pets and dealing with the public like I do, this is a great place.  Awesome for the younger crowd.  If you're looking to get your feet in the door, this is the place.  You're always busy so there's no slacking.  They promote if you work hard.
The fact that the opportunity to advance in PetSmart lies in the hands of stand out and acheivements along with working alongside great co-workers.Thomas. The gm is one great person.
As a seasonal employee in the PetsHotel, there was always something to do. The work wasn't especially stressful or hard, and management at the branch I worked at was great!

I was so excited to work at PetSmart but quit after my first day. They wouldn’t give me a schedule when they knew I had another job. They wouldn’t even work with my schedule because there’s other employees. They didn’t want me to do anything but cashier and just stand at the register when there’s no customers (makes no sense). I offered to help management but they said no. If they want to pay people to just stand   that’s on them. I can’t work like that. I never got paid either or uniforms. I wanted to do grooming but I’ll never go back again.
There's a lot of work( mostly under pressure), be prepared to work overtime, full weekends and in some cases holidays. The company is good, pro employees, the managers are not the same case....
I think about some the animals I formed a bond with during my time with PetSmart that I can't even remember my co worker's names. I would send my pet happily knowing they are on camera 24/7.

I enjoyed working at PetSmart for the most part. It was only part time for me until I finished school. I liked learning about the care and comfort of all the different kinds of pets and providing that care for them while I was working.

My bosses at Washington PetSmart are absolutely incredible. They care about their associates and the animals and pets that enter our store. Great associate relationships and passion for people and pets.
The most enjoyable part of the job is the pets.  Workplace culture is very stressful and co-workers lack professional demeanor.  Management is not properly trained to handle salon challenges

Fun place to work for those who love pets. Its a great place to start to get your foot in the industry as pretty much any job there is a great skill to build off of. My favorite part was the pets and helping the pet parents new and seasoned find what they are looking for. Management was not great at my location, which was a downside and promotions were hard to come by which is my reason for low stars. Overall however, I did not mind my experience here.

I worked at PetSmart doing a small number of things. Unfortunately, since I was good at one particular thing, that made me one of the only people to do it. I often helped to train new people doing the job I did as well. There wasn't much room to expand past what I worked as and it got quite lonely because more often than not, despite being around my fellow coworkers being the best part of the job, no one wanted to be near my post, since it was possible that they could be sucked into doing my job as well. The best part of the job for me, however, was the regulars. They were always friendly and told me about their days/weeks and asked me about my own week. I highly recommend, if you do work at a PetSmart, find those friendly regulars you can look forward to serving.

This company has been the best job I've ever worked at. I love working here and would like to try and get back into the company. Even though the pay sometimes sucks, it's still a great place to work at. I have met some of my best friends within this company and the best manager I have ever worked under.

I don't know if this is just my specific store but, I will say that it was a hard place to work. If I tried to communicated I'd get shut down or talked over and if I tried to focus on work it never felt like I was getting any direction or help. I wouldn't say it is the WORST possible place but, it can be challenging if you would like actual direction or leadership or even just a place where you can discuss issues openly without the worry of being told its your fault you feel that way.

The managers are bullies and do not care about their employees. Only about money and the customer whether or not the customer is in the wrong. I have been verbally abused by customers and then essentially told it was my fault and I deserved it, the manager in the salon bullied me and constantly and had her own policies that were very dangerous to the pet and the stylist.

I was always able to learn something new. Everyday was a new experience. Customer service is something I love doing, so engaging with the pet parents and they’re  pets was a fun experience. I like to also mention for the 4 years I was there, my customer service, management and team building skills have improved.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

Was treated very unfairly. They decided to remove me from the schedule and not inform me I was being fired until my last day. Their reason for firing me was that I was lazy, though I cleaned the whole salon and did all of the reminder calls when the other salon associates went home early. Was not trained for the job I was given and told to train a new bather, who constantly stopped me from my job to help her, but no one would stop to assist me if I was in need of help. The manager who hired me promised monthly reviews to ensure I did well but she quit and her replacement was disrespectful.

I have had great experiences and less than great experiences at PetSmart stores depending on the managers at the specific stores that I was working at. If you have a great team that's willing to support their staff no matter the cost, it's a fantastic job. However, you can also get managers with little experience in the company who focus too much on numbers to make themselves look good, and the store culture suffers for it.

I worked at Petsmart for about a month or so before I couldnt take it anymore. I was trained for one day on how to handle dogs in daycare, I knew nothing about what I was doing basically ever. Dogs were moved to different cages without telling anyone which resulted in multiple dog fights and attacks to people on the team. The team and management was rude and had no compassion for their members having a life outside of work. I was told not to ask for vacation time because I wouldnt get it. I left work everyday crying and couldnt take it after a month.
I was in love with the animals even though I did overnight stocking. All the employees came in ready to work and we always got the job done regardless of circumstances.

Working for petsmart was one of the best decisions I made. It led me down the career path as a dog groomer. I left working for them because a manager would not allow me to pursue the business I wanted to.

The people were really nice and helped you learn from your mistakes. I learned to be efficient, but also careful because you are dealing with customer's pets. I extremely enjoyed playing with the dogs in day camp, but I also loved keeping myself busy with all the tasks that needed to be done. I also learned how to manage and train new employees.
When I first started it was great. Once management changed in the store and in the salon it was not good. It's a high volume salon you have to keep up.
Had a great time with customers and the pets,  work could be demanding at times.  Mangers open door policy was nice if issues arose.  Some mistreatments of certain store managers caused some issues.
Loved working here! Great company, great employees! Everyone was friendly and got to see dogs everyday. Great for animal lovers. You learn a lot! You can take that knowledge anywhere you go!
Petsmart is a great place for pet lovers to work and shop. You get to work with and around animals and animal lovers. But unless your a manager or groomer you'll only get 10- 20 hours a week.
A typical day at work really doesn't occur.  Each day has its own duties and/or events.  I work as a cashier, pet care specialist, and my main duty is as Pet Trainer.

Working in the grooming salon at Petsmart was very enjoyable and rewarding. It's a very fast-paced environment most days, as I was always doing my own work as well as helping others with theirs. Management was reasonable and generally fairly understanding.
Personally did not like working at Petsmart. Customers were unhappy when I could not help them with vet related things. I don’t mind working in retail.

It was a fun place to work at. Some guests were difficult to work with but the management was usually always on your side. During this pandemic, the corporation did not give us hazard pay but expected us to wear mask but never provided masks. Was let go because of seniority yet a coworker of mine got to continue to work even tho she was hired 3 months after me.

A typical work day is about 7 hours and starts with being with the daycare dogs for the first few hours and then you start walking all individual dogs. After walking and feeding dogs you would start cleaning kennels.

A good 1st job or pet job for people trying to get into a pet field. Managment was always understanding and always helpful. Work culture was pretty chill and always felt like you alway had someone there to help you if you needed it
Are you like my job because it is so much fun and I like to see people I can like joke around sometimes I do my job seriously and I get things done on

Everyone who works here is a like-minded animal lover, so there is a real sense of community among the employees, even between the different areas of the store. And the variety of customers and pets who walk in the store make the work environment a very interesting place to be. I love working back in the hotel,where I get to watch over the dogs and cats who are staying there.

I work for this company for 10 years and at the end of that 10 years after all I had done building and training thier #1 salon team in the district and region along side the Store director of the #1store They brought in a new district manager from some grocery store somewhere who knew nothing about the pet industry on the retail side let alone on the  Service side Out of nothing but jealousy the corporation let him tear the whole team apart

I have served in two separate locations and as far as retail corporation go this one is doing a lot of right. There support from both leaders and corporate that are consistent in sharing the same objective with our 'pet parents'. This helps for both the customers and the associate for clear communication and conversing in objectives. Friendliness is highly encouraged and tends to keep a positive environment within the store and through its ability for employees to accomplish daily task. The structure is clear to whom is to hold responsibility in the store along with how that role affects the efficiency. In smaller store environments it becomes an easy way to be close nitch team. Its not best for pay, mostly being around minimum wage for part-timers but a lot of growth is supplied and local store leaders get to give managing opportunists to others from different backgrounds because of the role guidelines. The pay and benefits at a leadership level are much better then the part-timer.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

even before the pandemic, it sucked to work here. they don't hire new people often and when they do they're only trained on register or stocking. pet care at my store has dwindled to 3 people now, including myself. there's only one pet care person on shift at a time. we're the only ones who can get crickets and feeder fish, catch fish and pets to sell, and the only ones in the store that can troubleshoot customer problems with their tanks or pets. not even managers can answer any questions about pet care, because they don't know and aren't bothered to learn. no one in the store is able to assist when pet care gets busy, and we do get busy. on a regular Saturday, i would have to catch crickets, catch feeder fish, process a cat adoption, assist a family wanting to get a reptile for the first time, figure out why another customer's fish are dying, catch more fish, all in the span of a half hour, and all by myself. it gets overwhelming because I'm the only one in store that can do any of this, and when i ask for help while its happening or in general (more cashiers cross trained, more pet care certified employees), I'm treated like i should be able to handle it by myself, like i shouldn't need to pull managers away to help me for 10 minutes to thin out the crowd. if i need help with anything, I'm on my own.
It was a place I always felt comfortable showing up to and looked forward to my shifts. The other staff members are reliable and management is very approachable.
Management are snakes don’t trust anyone there they will use it against you  bad hours for workers and they are all stuck up  you get hurt they want you to go home and not report it

My store was very welcoming to those of the lgbt community, but lacked in other aspects. 1 manager to be specific, nothing you did seemed to please him but cool guy to talk to if you were talking sports. It was clear that they were only there to work and nothing else

Management is horrible. They told me that wouldn't work with me with my school schedule and because I signed a contract, I had to quit school... I have been told that my grooms are trash and told to " just quit" to my face. They won't work with groomers and force them to do more work than what they should. I had to put my dog down every 15 min to answer a phone or do a walk inin.inRidiculous and

Was a bather in the grooming salon for 2 years. Of course all my co-workers were women. Most of them were very catty and talked behind eachothers back, including the manager. Even some arguments and yelling.
Grooming experiences it all depends on your groomer some are amazing and wonderful to the animals and others are not so you just have to make sure to stick around and keep your eyes open

Would never recommend.  Promised much more than what the reality was.  No flexibility.  Poor morale.  Terrible pay.  High turnover for a reason.  Raise potential is promised but never given.  Always a reason for the lack if pay.  Expected to over perform in unethical ways.  Forced unachievable goals.  This includes how many adoptions your location is responsible for.  Miss adoptions and you will have to be on "outlier" calls that punish leaders.

It would be a lot of customers that would treat their pets like children, they really had a strong emotional attachment to their pets, and would always be treated like family when they stepped foot in the store.
Have patience and love animals. Also enjoy assisting customers. Working at PetSmart isn't a job it's a community for people with the love for pets and animals.

PetSmart could be an amazing company IF you have the right management staff. I was a manager at a previous location and loved every minute of it! But I also had an amazing team with the will to help others than themselves. I left the company for a year to advance my career and actually came back but to a different store. Only lasted a year and I was in the same position as before! Store manager was a joke. Very shady and so is the DM. Be warned.

I cannot speak for every grooming salon I have worked at a total of 3 and this review is only in regards to the last one. Management when I first got there was very lax and did not support my salon manager who had just become a salon manager and transferred there, the team did not respect her or her ideas. This made the work vibe very difficult. Then we got a new store manager and he backed up my salon manager but also was very forceful with his tactics saying Petsmart owned us and we would do what we were told to do... needless to say that did not end well. Then the teamwork was divided because there were a lot of favorites play in the salon so if a person did not like you they just would not help you leading to anything but stress and anxiety and a little bit of adult bullying. About 3 people quit and 2 transferred. For the good things about the job as soon as you become full time you get two weeks paid vacation and you do get sick days, the insurance was pretty good and not very expensive but an HMO at the time I worked there.
Flexibility is great. Nice company to work for. They worked with my very specific schedule and treated me like family. I loved working with the clientele.
Definitely a positive work environment with others promoting you challenge yourself to do better. Loving community, every customer comes in with a smile and if not they will leave with a smile.

Fun animals to work with while keeping you busy, the only downside is having to clean up constantly after pets (dogs to be specific) after they used the restroom. Overall a enjoyable work environment if you are strong willed and and a passion/love for animals.

As a seasoned pet care associate, my store managers have always been vocal about their appreciation for my work and I maintain a good relationship with them to this day. However, after working for the company for 4 years and consistently being one of the only people to finish daily tasks correctly and go above and beyond when it comes to animal welfare in our store, I have not received a raise in over 2 years. I only make 6 cents more per hour than a new hire, and for the amount of irate customers and sick animals that I have to deal with, it's just not worth it anymore. The fact that PetSmart corporate holds customer reviews over the welfare of its animals and its employees is too much to cope with, and I am not compensated fairly for the work that I put into this company.

I liked my supervisor and co-workers.  Didn’t like working different shifts most everyday.  Loved being around animals everyday.  Pay scale was low and stagnant.  Everybody but supervisors were part time.  So no benefits or perquisites.
good part time job for college students to work at. Manager is great. Communication could improve but t hey have been very flexible with my schedule which is great.

I loved working at Petsmart my favorite part was the animals in grooming they all had crazy funny personality. I would have to go in to help a groomer safely put a big dog on the grooming table.I love how the big scary looking dogs are the biggest babies. If you love animals this is the place for you and a crazy discount on pet food.

You take care of dogs. Not a whole lot to it but keep in mind to anyone looking to apply it's not as easy as you think there are many animals who are dependent on you and this environment can often get overwhelming to some who are not ready to commit to the responsibility of this job. Holidays can sometimes get out of hand and the days can be rough but there are a lot of great moments to be had in a great environment if you let it.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.
When I was working there the work culture was awful and the management was awful as well. The grooming salon was the worst. The main store manager was ok.
I like a clearly defined work schedule for my day.  PetSmart provides that. I am able to work independently but also be part of a strong team atmosphere.

Where do I start really nasty place to work. U do whatever u want take 25 min breaks hang out in the bathroom for whenever. Nobody cares People don't show up only a few here and there no leadership. Just really poor place to work.

Corporate is not realistic with their standards, threatens to write up groomers for not grooming enough dogs. They do not care about our safety or the pet's so long as we're making them money and not setting them up for a law suit. Overbooks staff via online booking and will complain if you have to cancel or reschedule appointments.

I've worked for PetSmart over 6 years and would definitely recommend them. I love what I do, I love my team, and I love the company. There's a feeling of family, and the fact that everyone you work with loves animals makes it even better. We are all doing what we love. Great environment, great opportunities to grow with the company, benefits, very good company.

Every day is fun, lots of animals to see and love. You learn a lot about animal care and handling, which in turn you teach to your customers. I would recommend it to students, they try to work with your schedule.
Best job ever!!! Best team to work with!!! If you love animals and is your passion go for it it’s worth it!!!! Company and managers they appreciate the good and hard workers and they show it to you
productive workplace some heavy lifting good pay and benifits very stable job throughout the year alot of forkilift positions and basic warehouse work

Found fulfillment in pet training and the job security is strong, but COVID-19 changed that.  As a trainer, you work with people and are relied on very strongly/ heavily, but there is no at- home or virtual options to conduct training during a pandemic or emergency
The foothillranch "pet hotel" is dog jail.

The first PetSmart PetHotel I worked at in Texas was a positive experience. I loved my coworkers and our regular clients. My managers were incredibly supportive and flexible, especially when a tornado hit my city which affected my ability to commute to work. Overall, the work environment was fun even though guests could be difficult and demanding. However, upper management often set unrealistic goals for its employees.

I’ve worked at a few pet stores and a lot with voluntarily helping animals. Every time I was diss appointed with the quality of care for the animals. Petsmart really goes above and beyond in making sure every animal, every customer, and every employee is satisfied at the end of every day.

PetSmart is a great place to start if you want an easy part time job. My experience  with management was 50/50 depending on who was there that day. Bad employees that really made the days unnecessarily stressful rarely received any kind of reprimand. It’s like they could get away with anything just because they were favorited. The hours aren’t great and can be cut with no notice. It’s okay starting place, but would not recommend a full time job.
Good environment and friendly treatment. Nice people and helping nature. Good learning and training facility. Flexible timings , team work and knowledge sharing . Working facilities are awesome

I've been a dog trainer with PetSmart for 10 years, and dog training is my passion. They give me adequate opportunities to sell classes, and speak highly of me to customers. I would be happy to keep working there, but due to Covid-19 they are currently cutting back hours, and have suspended the training program. Management varies from store to store and year to year, but overall I have had good relationships with my managers. The hardest part of the job is probably selling your classes in the early years before you've built up confidence and a reputation. Teaching requires patience and creativity. Customers can also be very rude sometimes, but the ones who sign up for training classes are nearly all pleasant people.
The work was humble, you are a janitor for dogs, cleaning kennels and preparing meals for dogs who stay the night at the hotel. Not hard work, you get to play with dogs all day!

I had gotten rear ended before work and essentially it made me late since we had to exchange info etc. my boss then accused me of not giving myself time to get there on time. She was always very rude and stand offish. I absolutely loved getting to work so closely with the animals but always getting treated less then is ridiculous! I would not recommend working here nor bringing your dogs here since they’re usually pretty rough handeling the dogs behind scene

This is a good place to work if you're in school or transitioning from job to job they really work with your schedule and important things you have going on in your life management is really helpful too.
Excellent company and management! Considerate of your schedule by being flexible. Family oriented. Great discounts. People friendly. Pet friendly. Kingsport location is convenient for me.
Good company to work for.  Management was very easy to get along with. Very flexible with work hours.  Other employees were very easy to work with and helped out when necessary.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

There are two types of people who work here: 1) people who are in high school or college working to get by; or 2) those who see the opportunity to promote by clawing, stabbing, and outright lying to get ahead.  If neither of these describes you, I’d advise looking for a job elsewhere.

You will learn a TON working for PS! They stay on topnof employee training and encourage you to discuss questions,  customer comments,  concerns,  etc. with vendors. Pet adoption days are loud,  chaotic,  adorable and amazing! I absolutely LOVED working for PetSmart!
Petsmart was a great place to work. They made it feel like home to everyone that came in and out. They a have to be one of the jobs I really liked. Great place.
checking in clients for their services
A great way start a career path to working with animals. There is always room for growth with this company. The job is what you make of it a long with your team   When you are a leader.
My time here started off great and I enjoyed working with the animals, but over time I found that the management of my Boise store did not have the animals best interest at heart.

I learned a lot about the needs of many different animals which was my favorite part. Great and understanding managers who you can have fun with while working. My biggest dislike was the obsession of stats like the number of customers who walk in but leave without a purchase. Many people stop in just to see the animals with no intention of spending money and I felt it was unfair to hold the associates accountable for those numbers.

My time at Petsmart was okay.  I did have 4 or 5 customers who preferred me over someone else, but my time there wasn't very educational (loss of words really).  Groomers there, they were very friendly and very sweet, but when it came down to it, it's basically every groomer and bather for themselves.  I was brought in in August of 2017, in the hopes that I would get to go to the all inclusive grooming school they have.  I never got the chance to go, no matter how hard I worked.  They always found something wrong with me or the job I was doing.  I put in a lot of effort being there.  I helped repaint the bathing area and kennel run.  I reorganized a lot when I was bored and looking for something to do. In my opinion, go to Petco or maybe a Mom and Pop grooming salon.  They're a lot better and more advanced in my eyes.

You have to sell and recommend services and if you don’t meet goals they send the district manager to you salon. You have your own appointments and then have to take care of walk-ins which gets very hectic on weekends and holidays. Don’t work here if you can’t follow procedures and don’t like constantly being watched. Also, most days you don’t even take a lunch because it’s so busy.

I love the safety policies. And the health policies and the equipment and most times the customers (give or take a few people who think we are not actual human beings.). But what I DON'T like is the amount of

Managers would often belittle people who didn't fit in or coworkers would talk about each other behind their backs. The only upside to this job was to work with animals, but the education for care was insufficient and I would often have to do my own research.
If you're starting a grooming career here it's a great place to begin. The hiring process was easy and the people who work here genuinely care about animals and their well being.

Pay is very low compared to other jobs,  for many of us this is a career and we are paid less than the starting pat at in and out burgers.  PetSmart talks about taking care of employees, but, its just talk.
I really enjoy working for petsmart and the company. They are great people.

So if you're looking for a job that you can work with a wide variety of animals in a fast pace working environment with, this may be a job for you. I have to say: You MUST do your OWN research on the animals. Either bosses will know next to nothing about the animals you're selling, or you will get lucky and have a boss that actually took the time to learn themselves. Either way, the knowledge of the animals won't come over night, and this isn't a job where you should half a-- your research. The safety and well-being of the animals lies directly in your hands. So do your research, and don't rely on PetSmart's "education" to help you figure it out. Trust me, a lot of the curriculum is there to get you to sell animals with the sh-- they sell. Oh, and don't skip the fish education. Fish is literally most of this job.

Things where great before they got bought out. The company cared about their animals in-store. I was allowed to bend corporate policy to make sure the animals got the best care. If something got sick, off to the vet it went, no need for approval. Then  they got bought out by a private company, they promised so much, better animal care, everything. Nothing changed for the better, sadly for the worse. Depending on your management, things did get better, but not always. I left because I couldn't stand seeing sick animals not getting the care they needed, and seeing the animals not being given correct care to keep them happy. Not all stores where like this, but sadly mine was.
Working at Petsmart was great until the latest managers arrived . They only care about the money being made NOT about the health of the animal or employees!
Wage is determined when hired. So newer employees doing the same job might get paid more than you. Management plays favorites which limits any possibility of advancement.

I was able to cross-train for many positions within this company and polished various skills such as customer service, marketing, public speaking, appointment taking, self-branding, and team building.

IF I were you, I'd avoid this company.  The management is NOT in tune with understanding HOW to build a cohesive TEAM that SERVES the CUSTOMER.  Try to find another company to work for because you most likely will be dissatisfied on multiple levels.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

I love working with the dogs in the grooming salon. It’s a lot of fun and very fulfilling if you love animals. However, as a company, it’s awful. Corporate is overbearing, competent managers are suffocated by overbearing incompetent management, and the company culture - it’s abominable. Discrimination and disrespect are shrugged off, no matter how many people point it out and fight to have something done. If you want a diverse, accepting, supportive workplace, this isn’t it. If you want to keep to yourself and have this as a temporary stepping stone, go for it. But if someone decides to talk down to you or discriminate against you, you will be ignored and expected to suck it up no matter how damaging. It’s a company that doesn’t care for it’semployees at all, and it’s clear from the work policies to the treatment of employees.
The most enjoyable part of the job (applies to salon) is that there is always something new to learn, always a new grooming skill available to pick up.

While on the surface the company maintains that they care about animals in their direct care, they will do almost everything to undermine their own policies & procedures in the name of making the customer happy. Management gives no support and follows the same practice- satisfy the customer no matter the cost, but pinch the pennies when it comes to caring for the live exotic animals in their care.

Working with animals and most of the customers was actually very enjoyable and fun. Other regular associates were mostly very nice and friendly and made it enjoyable, however the management was the worst management I have seen in my working experience. The first store leader we had actually did a good job and was unbiased and friendly but not too friendly with his associates. The new store leader that took over a little over a year into my time there was too afraid to confront problem employees who she thought would cause confrontation, was very friendly with certain associates who would buy her food/drinks which also included alcoholic beverages. The assistant store leader would spend most of his time on the clock either sitting in the managers office scrolling for hours on the computer, be actively talking on his phone for personal calls on the floor, and go on 'errands' to pick up small items for the store where he would be gone for 1-2 hours at least while on the clock. Other smaller managers like the associate lead and pet care manager would set new policies that are suppose to limit management and associates alike, then they claim they're making the exception for themselves.

After spending months training, I was passed over on going to grooming academy several times due to having a "full class" but management and the instructor would insist I would have a spot 'next month' but continued that cycle for several months. Toxic work environment as well.
Does not always have enough hours allocated. This leaves periods of time when not enough staff is available to help customers. It also makes it challenging to get projects done with less staff.
I love my job...the management/co workers are like family to me! I enjoy going to work and seeing my regular customers/pets...i have made new friends and loyal customers! Grear place to work...

I’v been working here for a while the only thing that keeps me still working here is the animals Iv seen and loved for years , it’s a lot of favoritism. Iv seen many dogs sitting in urine and not having water, for some reason they believe it’s ok to give a owner their dog that smells like straight urine . Many people here are lazy. Overnights are stressful due to the fact they want you to do a lot in a few hours. Iv seen many things that people have done that should of gotten them fired or that corporate should of gotten involved in but that I will not mention. It is far from a team , many people here talk behind each other’s backs about their work ethic , personal life etc . Many people get charged for things they did not receive wether it’s a playtime or not spending the whole day in camp. Many people cannot handle stress well they get overwhelmed and start talking crazy to each other and boom there’s tension and someone’s upset . It’s a mess
PetSmart was one of the best places I've worked! I absolutely loved my job there. They were even gunna help me get into grooming school. They are super awesome!

My work day consisted of self motivation to help customers and their pets.  Management was a little lacking but it was a corporate run company. On a daily basis I felt satisfied with my work and the job I preformed.
I love working at pet smart it was a good job Good job. It was a great learning experience for me and it teach me how to grow. I learn so much from petsmart i would not have change it.
Unfortunately I didn't get to work here as long as preferred. My coworkers had great attitude and was company driven. Its always a positive feeling to work with a company with great customer skills!

Very unprofessional very poor management. No one will tell you that your not paid for jobs you have to keep tally yourself to make sure money is correct. Management very unprofessional and childish. New staff appear very often. Turnover rate is high.

Minimal staff with unacheivable goals. No help with tasks you just have to figure it out. Managers are condescending and show up late. Double standards. People with less experience get paid more than those with more experience and responsibility. Get written up for not working fast enough. Not a fun place.

I loved the work but management made the job uncomfortable.  Holding a grudge if sales goals were not reached. I loved working around animals and pet owners. Other than the pressure from management, I was happy to go to work everyday.

While I was working at this location I did both picking and packing for petsmart products and companies similar. The items would vary depending on the order you was picking or packing, it could either be dog, cat or other house animals beds, food, lining, etc....
it was great experience to work with petsmart. the environment was collaborative . i learnt a lot in this client location . culture was very nice.

The managers here couldn’t  care less about you, all they care about is making money but not about the employee who make them there money! Talking  to corporate does no good they don’t even answer half the time . The turn over rate for Williamsburg va speaks for it, they can not keep groomers because there poor management and insufficient equipment

This job offered some stability. If you were seeking a lot of hours, there were easy ways to do this. There was always overtime available. The managers can quickly pick out who is putting in more effort and reward them.

I was a bather that went above and beyond to make sure the pets were taken care of properly, that my coworkers were happy, and that the salon was clean. Management, however, did not care about me because I had no interest in becoming a groomer. The process to become a groomer is lengthy and involves doing more work for the same low pay until finally PetSmart decides to pay you for your work. I was not willing to be put through that so I maintained my work ethic of being a great bather. Management did not recognize my hard work and lied about getting me a raise. So I got out of there as fast as I could. My coworkers were really great, but that differs at each location. Most groomers don't care about the bathers.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

The work environment was conducted freely and unprofessionally ! Management was new to the job ! and  had no idea what they we're doing... They didn't even have a certified forklift to operate the forklift.

This job was good, but very stressful as far as structure. I disliked being left alone during training time when I did not have adequate training to run the salon alone. I loved working with the dogs.
The experience you get working at PetSmart can be rewarding. You learn all kinds of facts about dogs and cats and learn how to interact with customers.

Overall my experience was mediocre. I don’t suggest working here for longer than a year if even that. Staff isn’t very appreciated. Some managers were great but the head manager is overall awful. She acted fake, was never there on time or at all and did not care for others. I was there for a whole year before I got my first raise or employee review which are supposed to be both done during month 1, 3, 6 and a year. I only ever got one raise while people hired on after me with less experience were making a way higher wage.My schedule was super full and I had many tasks to complete, I felt under appreciated and overwhelmed often. They only care about a select few employees and often times it shows. No room for advancement at all, unless you are one of there “pets”. Often times I dreading going to work and went anyways due to the animals needing care. I genuinely cared about the animals and that was the only reason I stayed as long as I did.

You can’t trust anyone Supervisors are not there to help you at all, they are only there to get their bonuses. If you can’t help them get that you’re gone . This place use to be great, now I can’t get out of there fast enough

My salon team became like family where we were like bothers and sisters and had each other's backs with things like end of groom inspections, scheduling appointments, team work and learning techniques to improve production times. Full time positions which are manager and Salon personnel are offered the most outstanding benefits and outside company discounts. You can have good days and you can have bad days. It can get hard getting attached to clientele, customers and/or the animals that are brought in and things happen, nature happens and when it does it makes it real hard to concentrate so fair warning, you have to be a tough cookie without being rude.

Managers are always looking to support you emotionally and never beat you down for messing up. If you come in with a good attitude, you will be fine. Not all fellow co-workers are as understanding. Most are tired and aren't really looking to help out a newbie so it's best to think on your feet and try to solve things rationally. The managers don't mind helping however so if they are around, make sure to ask before doing anything. I felt very comfortable overall. One thing I hated was that despite it being CLEARLY the pet owners responsibility to pick up after their pet, some can be irresponsible. Most of the time you can get away with pointing out to them that they have to clean up (wipes and bags are provided readily throughout the store), but some think if they walk away fast enough they won't get caught.

I worked in the hotel: Aside from the animals, EVERYTHING there was horrible. The work environment was extremely toxic, the people I worked with all moved in cliques and if they didn't like you it was evident because they would collectively ostracize you, talk badly behind your back & stick you in doggy day camp every single work day. Not only did I witness this happen to several hotel staff, it also eventually happened to me. All the co's (usually new) who didn't get along with the co's (which include managers & supervisors) would quit after 3 weeks (top) because they felt invisible, useless, left out and couldn't take it anymore. I was the last one to finally quit last year. I tried to stay longer for the dogs and the dogs ONLY but I was soo miserable and unhappy there. Who would've thought working at a place lik Petsmart would be so detrimental to ones mental health? I'm warning anyone thinking of working at the Pelham location, DON'T. It's probably the easiest job to get but it is not worth it.

My co workers and I work at the pet smart in el segundo, and they are cutting all of our hours because they believe we don’t deserve them based on their bias, and many of us need our hours because only management is full time here
A typical day in PetSmart sort of depends. Some days can be an easy night, whereas certain days it feels exhausting. Management slacks effort to help their employees in their daily tasks.

I worked as an MIL at PetSmart and thought most things were alright. It is a very physically demanding job, but I felt fairly compensated for that. My main complaint is that I felt I had too many tasks to complete in an allotted amount of time. A lot of times the goals they set for me were unrealistic, coming from someone who generally does well in a time crunch. Overall, working there was about a 3/10. It definitely had its ups and downs. It was easy to move up.

Have to open the department meaning feeding all the animals making sure they are in good healthy conditions. Taught very little basics on animals best to do research on animals in store to give feedback to customers or if every owned any animals use that knowledge.

This job takes a lot out of you. It is not easy to work with animals and people who just don’t care. Management only cares about money and how much the business is making. Petsmart does not care for the care of their own animals they sell.
Bathe dogs, clip their nails, schedule appointments, answer phone calls, give basic information about services we provide, recommend services you think would be best for someones dog.

Corporate cares more about keeping rude customers whoe get everything for free, and shows no appreciation for hard-working employees. Managers are just corporate puppets and will do anything to cover themselves before their employees. Corporate does not have their employees backs whatsoever. They push for quantity over quality. Corporate is so cheap they will refuse improving infrastructure, fixing damages, and repairing/paying for new equipment that could all improve sales, efficiency, work happiness, and pet safety.

After experiencing poor animal care leading to nearly a dozen deaths I could no longer handle it. The work itself was very enjoyable and fun. The management team cares more about making money and sales goals than the health and happiness of animals.

Management sucked completely. It was every man for himself. There was bullying within. Was promised a position and trained for it but it was taken from me as soon as I was in the middle of being trained. Hours were made for those who are in high school.
Over all a great job but they tend to care more about their customer happiness than their employees at times. I had the pleasure of working with a manager that was better in this aspect than most.

Place was not a bad place to work at but had to deal with a lot of internal issues. Management could have been better and more detailed on all the departments. Climbing up the ladder always seemed harder to do.
It was a wonderful learning experience and I made many connections not only with management but with my peers. I'd definitely work here again and improve my work ethic.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.
I liked working with animals and it helped me give back to the owners who couldn't take the time to properly groom their own pets .I got to know and take care of the different breeds of animals.
Great teamwork, corporate aspect expects alot from a pet store and sales from a salon with slow times but good first time job for beginner and to learn new careers.
I've been with petsmart, for over 10 years.  I worked from a position as a cashier to a career as a dog groomer. I absolutely love my job. Petsmart has been a big part of my life.

Loved my salon leader and most of the women I worked with. Managers in merchandising were very disrespectful to the employees when the salon leader was not present. The job itself was very fast paced but a pleasure to have all the different breeds coming through the door. Built a clientele very fast!
I love it I know every manger in the three stores that are close to me. They are all friendly and care. I would never regret getting that job lived every minute.
I like working for the company. We do get discounts. Company also owns Chewy.com and is associated with The Banfield Pet Hospital. Wellness Plans are offered for our pets. I recommend it.

They base hours off their reward program sign ups, so if you work busy hours when nobody wants to sign up it'll effect your score and you'll be scheduled less. Managers are very unorganized and aren't will ing to work with you or offer you more hours. Most managers just tell you're wrong and won't teach you hwo to do anything correctly.

I love working with animals and making them look good, but it can become hectic especially if it’s a high volume store. I enjoy my coworkers but the salon is sadly really small and sometimes uncomfortable to work in.

You definitely Need an inside recommendation to get in this job most the time but if you can actually get in you’ll absolutely love it. This job is definitely for people who love all animals and can deal with rude customers who think they’re so special they deserve to have the rules bent for them. Management is 10/10 and nip any type of drama or problems in the butt. Absolutely love the environment here.

I was very happy to work there, there's a time in the week when an organization goes with cats and dogs so they can get adopted and I found that is the most precious thing petsmart can do for animals. Just let them be there, yes!
This would have been a better workplace if there was better staffing, management, and store leadership. Unrealistic workload, not properly trained, bribed for full-time positions, underpaid.

I loved certain parts of the job when i was working for petsmart. Having constant interaction with dogs and cats on a daily basis was bliss. I was trained on many things including; grooming techniques, coat differences, dog breeds, first aid for animals, trim nails, and proper bathing etiquette. These skills I still use at home with my own animals and I am grateful for that experience. On the other side of the coin though, management can be flaky. The grooming department is different then working in the general store. All in all not a bad place to work.
A great company to work for, has decent benefits and great work atmosphere. The employees are nice and helpful in assisting you to grow and succeed. A great place to grow into management.

I feel  like it's really a relaxing place to work. Especially if you enjoy working with animals. I definitely learn something everyday. If you prefer to stay in one spot for a while and make quick transactions with customers, I recommend cashiering here!

Safety Committee, receiving product, fulfilling store orders, ensuring that orders are filled (accurately, timely and efficiently) and packaging and preparing the product for shipping; heavy lifting, up to and including 70 lbs. standing and walking, up to and including 12 hours shift.
Not grate to work for the management isn’t grate they wouldn’t give me time it help when I need it it wasn’t a grate place to work they did help a lot with sum things
I’ve held several retail management positions, Petsmart happens to be the best one. Many opportunities and if you have a need to help others, this is the company for you!

I enjoyed my time working in grooming at Petsmart and loved working at the front as cashier some days. I mainly was a groomer and i absolutely loved working with dogs and making them perfect for their parents! Seeing the pups come in and leaving as new beautiful fur babies was always the best part. The only bad part was they didn't give me enough hours and then my boyfriend passed away and i just could not stay there anymore.
Great place to work, you can learn a lot here if you pit your mind to it but it is just a job. Management was okay most of the time. Put your schedule in early.

You feel that you can learn what you need to help people really take care of their pets. It's rewarding to see customers happy. Management is good about promoting manager positions from within the company.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.
The place is cool if you love dogs When I First Started Everybody Was Warming  after awhile everything went south  work hard and get small pay  management needs work
Working at pet smart grooming has taught me a lot about myself but mostly dogs. Everyone I work with is very helpful if I need the help. They’re all very kind!

New hires are not properly or thoroughly trained (speaking mostly for the grooming salon, specifically), making them ill-prepared for the hectic environment and specialized skills required for the job.

I would constantly be overbooked. As a bather I did not make commission and was overbooked without being consulted. This would put me behind and cause customer complaints. I was bullied by my other employees and was never thanked for anything I did although making the most money for the salon.
The company itself is great. They have amazing procedures and policies to keep everyone safe and happy. Its a very charitable company. The employees are pretty tight knit and friendly.

The managers here dont develop talent and help the cultivate a healthy culture. They are overworked and stressed out and that trickles down through the ranks. You can feel it everywhere in here. Its depressing and hard to keep coming to work with a positive attitude. The thing that kept me going was my clients. They made my days brighter. Also because I was soo busy I rarely got consistent breaks.breaks

Some of the managers are young, and on a power trip. The managers buddy buddy up with certain employees and let them do whatever they want. The hours are not good if you’re looking to put in a decent amount of hours.

Petsmart is an amazing place to work, they genuinely care about you as a person not just an employee! They work with your schedule and if you have any interest in working with animals as a career this is a AMAZING place to start!

Petsmarrt is still a retail job so you are going to have to do physical labor and guest service.  At Petsmart the customer is always right even if they are not right.  Petsmart is like other retailers and their are a lot of numbers to hit.  However, the leaders that I encountered were some of the leaders that I have ever worked for.  The leaders did in fact care about pets, people and my team and I.  PetSmart did leave the stock market and they were bought out by a private company.  There have been a lot of changes as a result of this buy out.  I still know some of the leaders in upper management and they do greatly care for the teams.  One of the most awesome aspects of working at Petsmart is the PetSmart Charities and the adoptions that they do.  They have saved so many lives of pets in the community.  Also, PetSmart has an amazing human resource team that is fair.

When I first applied at the home office I was really excited to start a corporate career with PetSmart and was told it would be easy to move up. It’s unfortunately not the place it seems to be. The company does not care about the staffing needs within the call center. They will have 30+ people making outbound calls to check up on people who haven’t had their dogs groomed in 8 weeks, while

Many of the managers were catty and unrealistic when it came to the duties of this position. This is a hectic location, especially on the weekends and holidays. During the holidays, the hotel would be completely booked, and there were still only two people allowed overnight. There were many nights when I was by myself with over 100 pets, which seems unsafe and was incredibly stressful. There was a high turn over rate because the pay clearly is not worth the stress and physical labor. Another reason for high turnover is the lack of necessary training. The only enjoyable aspect of this position was the cute and well-behaved dogs.
Get to see and/or work with animals. Some management is good at coaching and helping you develop skills. Some opportunity for advancement if you work really hard and are commited.

There was very attentive training there; they really value customer care and are overall pretty lively people to work with. There really isn't very much slow hours there though so if you prefer to always be working on something or another this is a good place to be.

Do not work at this location. They don’t care about treating their employees fair. Too much drama in their salon. The new management has no clue how to run her own store. Look up reviews before you apply

With being a pet trainer, I am able to have direct and constant communication with my clients, this allows me to problem solve and ensure complete satisfaction as I do my job. I enjoy the impact I make on the lives of families and their pets. Making a difference is my aim and my goal.

I really liked this job for the most part. Customers are 95% great! However 6 months in got branches into a trainer. My ‘area manager’ is sexist. Bulled me and my fellow trainee, also a girl, until she had a panic attack. Management did nothing. Multiple incidents. Steals your clients to fill his pockets. They also cut your hours after you branch out saying you’ll ‘compensate’ with your classes. Real bs.
Coworkers are great but, and there is a great love for pets.  The job is very fast paced and you have to answer phone calls while grooming.  A couple managers are horrible with teamwork.

I was always very busy at Petsmart, working the phones, scheduling appts, checking guests in/out, grooming 6+ dogs a day and running the front of the salon. I loved getting to know the customers as the years went by, as well as their pets.
Customer Service in is the number one priority. Product knowledge runs a close second for without it, customers will not be satisfied. Answering cutomer questions sets the company apart.
Management does not help most of the time and things that are in need of repair is over looked. You never do enough they want you to do more dogs that you can.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.
Loved working there! Everyone was always nice and loved helping. The grooming salon was always clean and ready for work. Great environment. Mangers were always kind and helpful
Mostly really awesome coworkers, a lot of hours need to be put into the job. Great opportunity for advancement for people of all levels of education. Overall good place to work.
They work you like robots. Unless you are management your wants and lives do not matter. My manger barely worked and wouldn’t give me a schedule to help compensate my sons schedule.
loved my management position

I enjoyed my time at PetSmart. Managers were focused on employee growth. I felt valued at this company and the pay was sufficient for the job. The job does require hard work and sometimes crazy hours, but they always showed they appreciated their employees. They are also accommodating for college students and are very compassionate.

Petsmart is a great store! Fun workplace, especially if you are a animal lover! They have awesome teamwork, they will help you solve any problem you have in any situation. The managers are really good at their jobs and are great listeners!

I absolutely love my role as a petshotel leader. The interaction between pets and pet parents is the most rewarding experience daily.  Routinely we tend to the needs. Of our pets through a hands on approach.

I’ve been with PetSmart for two years. Promoted from PetCare associate, to Associate Lead, to merchandise and inventory manager. Let me tell you. You’re not being paid enough. Basic associates are only making $1.50/hour less than I am and lower level managers are making $3.00 more than I am.
Good work life balance. Respect among employees. Management knows what they are doing. Come on time do your work no problem. Very good company to work for
Good company with opportunities for growth, and excellent benefits. Management is hit or miss by location but for the most part a great job to get you into the retail environment.
Petsmart distrubtions center was an good  job. Plenty of benefits, well managed, good working environment, get recognition & compensation for your hard work
I loved petsmart I was fired after clippi83 dogs while I was there. I needed glasses and did not know. I need fair chance to be rehire
The company creates a Stressful work place.

Cashiers are usually left by themselves on a busy Saturday or Sunday. It’s a given that you will be overwhelmed and your line will get long  Luckily, you can call a manager over and they will help ring
Petsmart does treats its associates very well but are most of the times understaffed. They mostly only hire part timers and get around 15-20 hours a week.
Managers are always helping to further your career at Petsmart.  My time spent here is enjoyable and productive.  I cant say enough about this company.
I believe it would be the best place to work for. They are always eager to help their customers and makes them feel welcomed and appreciated in their stores.

Great location, onsite gym, daycare, cafeteria, and secure premises. The work was meaningful with great impact. The only drawback was that the hourly workers didn’t receive annual bonuses like upper management....totally unfair. I left after 18 months for a company that truly rewards their employees.

Check in and right away see the dogs that you have appointments with u greet them,talk to them ask questions. Then off you go bathing your dog brush out clipping nails trimming bails and eat. it was so fun working with them little dogs. coworkers are great.

My experience at PetSmart was great! Management + coworkers make the job what it is. When I started working there I loved it, but as time went on and management started to changed it got stressful. Towards the end of my time working there, there were things going on between other co-workers and manager relationships that just weren't good and made very uncomfortable.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

PetSmart truly is a good retail company to work for. They genuinely care about their customers and the animals in their care, more so than the Associates who work there. This isn't to say they don't care about the team, but like so many retail companies, they are feeling the pinch from the online takeover and they are going into defensive mode (raising prices, cutting labor).
